title: Cables in the Same Enclosure
fullText: Conductors of safety services shall not be enclosed with conductors of different safety services or with conductors of any other system.

applications.text: If a duct or trunking is divided into separate channels by means of fixed and continuous barriers that provide effective segregation, each channel may be regarded as a separate enclosure.
Wiring systems complying with Clause 7.2.2.2 may be considered to provide effective segregation.
Wiring systems within switchboards shall be separated from all other wiring systems by at least 50 mm or by effective barriers.
